intro: Urostachys helmii, commonly known as the spiral grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves around its stem, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Urostachys helmii is valued for its unique morphology and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
